fields.author: John
fields.title: Paperboy
fields.body:
Focus

The focus of Paperboy company is to come up with fresh ideas for different kind of paper products and put it on the market. We offer high-quality products that are beneficial to our customers. We also want our our loyal customers to be a big part of the growth of our business. We're really listening and value any feedback about your experience.keep connecting with us!


Design Goals

My goal for the design of this site is to work on the basic template of razor pages and improve it by adding more features.The guys at the microsoft did a great job with the implementation and design of the template.The basic template comes with a database functionality that uses CRUD operations, a user management system(asp.net identity), and more cool stuff.I improved the template by turning this into an eCommerce site, changing the over look of the site, and adding more useful features, such as, paypal payment option, etc.


Project Work

Individual


Main Elements

Home

  • This page contains the basic information of the company. It has a description for the reviews of the site and for how to sign up.


About

  • This page contains a more detailed information of the company.It has a description for the vision, mission, and future plans for the company.


Contact

  • This page contains contact information about our company. For example, phone number, company's address, and company's email.


Products

  • This page contains a list of premium paper products that the company sells.


Rate the Website!

  • Registered users can leave a feedback about their experience in this page.

Register or Log in User Profile

  • Users can register or log in and update their information on these pages.

Links

    Go to Website

    paperboy.zip 8.8mb (11.3 mb unzipped)

    Github Repository
fields.carousel: Previous Next

fields.author: John
fields.title: Hacker's Island
fields.body:
Hacker's Island is a 2D platformer / point and click educational game made with Unity engine. The game is focused on story,exploration and learning. One of the main characteristics of the game is that you'll learn some of the effective ways on how you can protect yourself against hackers in real life. this project is inspired by the hit television show Mr. Robot.


Features

  • Stylish 2d Gameplay
  • Unique and Engaging Story
  • 1-2 Hours long

Story

Every year, hackers from all over the world travels to a place called Hacker's Island and join the most prestigious hacking tournament on the planet. The stakes are high this year because the most notorious yet illusive hacker "brocol33t" is joining the competition.


Controls

  • Arrow keys or A and D Keys: Move Character
  • Left and Right mouse button: Fire projectiles/pointing
  • Space key: Jump

Project Work

Individual


Platform

  • Windows
  • Internet browser

Links

    Play in browser (Recommended browser: Mozilla Firefox)

    hackers-island.zip 47.2mb (182 mb unzipped)

    Github Repository
fields.carousel: Previous Next

fields.author: John
fields.title: Nirvana Resort
fields.body:
Focus

The focus of Nirvana Spa Resort is to provide an oasis for people to escape from their daily routine and experience healthy relaxation, rejuvenation and adventure at an extraordinary resort. The resort offers amazing scenic views, luxury accommodations, healthy and nutritious meals prepared from locally grown produce, revitalizing spa services, and many activities that will make for an unforgettable and transformative experience.


Design Goals

My group's design aimed to produce an attractive site, evoking a sense of calmness and serenity that highlights the company’s extraordinary amenities, a very functional site, validation checks and services. We created a unified look to the website using an easy to follow layout using breadcrumbs and employing the 3-click rule. We used image-rich pages to highlight the resort’s impeccable views, and provide a clear description of the services, activities, and accommodations. We implemented a user managament for our users and administrators. Only registred users are allowed to make spa reservations or buy spa packages. The administrator can approve or decline the reservations made by the user or delete a specified user on the admin's page.


Project Work

Group


Main Elements

The Resort

  • This page contains information about our company and our mission of providing service to our guest. It also has a description of the resort property, the services are offered, as well as photos of different areas of the resort and its amenities.

Spa Services

  • Massages – this sub-page list different types of massages offered, such as Swedish massage, Thai massage, hot stone massage, energy therapies, etc…
  • Bath Treatments – this subpage list different bath treatments offered, such as stress-relief, detoxifying, cellulite treatments
  • Facials – age-defying, resurfacing stem-cell facial, exfoliations, extractions, full face-lift.
  • Manicure/Pedicure – regular, no-chip

Attractions/Activities

  • Night life - Information about the nearby local restaurants, events or nightclubs.
  • Outdoor activities - Information about the different sports (e.g. tennis, kayaking, hiking, scuba diving)
  • Indoor activities – fitness classes, yoga, Pilates, swimming, nutrition classes

Food – describes food available at the resort

  • Resort Restaurant and Lunch Buffet
  • We serve fresh vegetables we get from local farmers.
  • Healthy style menu prepared by an in-house chef using healthy, organic, locally grown produce and free-range meats.
  • Extensive vegetarian options available

Reservations and Packages – where guests can reserve accommodations and purchase packages

  • Specials deals
  • Gift Cards
  • Spa packages

Links

    Go to Website

    nirvana.zip 12.9 mb (16.2 mb unzipped)

    Github Repository

fields.author: John
fields.title: Bad Seal Studios (OLD)
fields.body:
Focus

The focus of Bad Seal Studios is to create a website where I can upload and showcase my projects. This website will inspire me to create challenging projects that I can share with other programmers. I will post my opinion and share insights about different topics that are related to information technology. I'm going to create video tutorials and text tutorials to help my fellow programmers on where they're having difficulties with. I also created this website because I want to have a better understanding with web development, especially Angular.


Design Goals

My goals for the design of this site are to produce a simple looking but elegant site, easy to read texts, responsive images, fast performance, and lots of useful functionalities. I chose Angular as the framework for my website because it's quite simple and easy to follow, it helps to build fast and consistent front-end website, and coding with Typescript is a lot of fun.


Project Work

Individual


Main Elements

Home Page

  • This page contains information about projects, news, announcements, and more.

About Page

  • This page contains information about the goals for my website, personal information, etc.

Projects' Page

  • This page contains all of the projects. The projects can be sorted in four different categories (All, Video games, Web Applications, and Others).

Tutorials' Page

  • This page contains tutorials about different programming topics.

Calendar Page

  • This page contains tech events around Chicago area.

Links

    Go to Website

    paperboy.zip 30 mb

    Github Repository

fields.author: John
fields.title: Meditation Countdown Timer
fields.body:
focus

the focus of this app is to help to time your progress with activities such as cooking meals, yoga, taking quizzes, work, sports, meditation and more. The timer can be set from 1 minute up to 1 hour. The options to pause or reset the timer are available. A loud chime is played when the time reaches 0.

design goals

I wanted to make the design for this project to be simple and cute. I added a reset button, refresh button, play button, readable text for the countdown timer and an animated seal.

project work

individual

Main Elements

Main Screen

  • Displays the countdown timer and all the features of the app


Links



    Github Repository

fields.author: John
fields.title: Hacker News
fields.body:
focus

The focus of this project is to be able to fetch and display a list of top news from the Hacker News website on mobile devices, and to be able to display its content, such as comments, author’s name, upvote count, and details about the article.

design goals

To make the application user friendly as possible, I added a few refresh buttons that refetches the latest data. I also added a bottom navigation bar for an easier way of scrolling. I chose the white color texts in a grey/black background for better readability.

project work

individual

Main Elements

Home page

  • Shows a list of the top news from the Hacker News Website.

News details page

  • When the user taps one of the news, this page will show the comments and the article’s details about that news.

About page

  • Contact info, project details, etc.

Links



    Github Repository

fields.title: I graduated college! +New project
fields.body:
Hello friend. It’s been a while since my last post because I was busy working on a project and prepping for my graduation. Last Monday, May 7, 2018, I finally graduated College with a B.S. in computer science. I’m so happy that I don’t have to do any homework anymore or submit an essay paper 10 minutes before the deadline ☺. I can now finally focus on the bigger picture which is working towards my career in IT and, of course, to continue learning and improving. I’m also considering to go back to school in the future to continue studying for a master’s degree.




About my new project, I made a non-serious eCommerce site called Paperboy that sells different kind of premium paper products. The website is built with .net core razor pages and C#. I had a lot of fun working on this project because Razor pages is quite fun to learn. I feel like razor pages is suitable for all kinds of developers from beginners to pro level. If you’re new to C# and looking for a good place start, I recommend you to jump in and play around with razor pages.

Check out Paperboy by clicking the link below:

Paperboy's Page


What am i going to work on next? Well, to be honest, I'm not sure. I can continue learning Angular and add more features to this website or I can move on to my next project which is going to be a video game or something else. Don't get me wrong, I'm really excited to work on these projects, but Im looking for something different and more serious.

That's all for now, till next time!

fields.title: BREAKDOWN: What is Blockchain Technology?
fields.body:
This tweet by Mr. Elon Musk inspired me to talk a little about blockchain technology. Many companies used this term as a "buzzword" and they don’t understand what it is. So, what exactly is a blockchain technology?

First of all, Bitcoin is not blockchain. Many digital currencies, including bitcoin, are using a blockchain technology to prevent a digital coin from having multiple owners. In the real world, doing a transaction is quite simple. If I’m going to buy a book from a bookstore, I will give them my cash and then I will be the only owner of that book. On the internet, we put our trust in a person or representative to create and maintain the only virtual copy of an item. This means that they have more control over that item against the buyer and they can manipulate it. Using the blockchain technology, a person can transact with another person with integrity. In addition, Participants can check the validity of any transactions without the need for a representative or a third party. Furthermore, there will be fewer restrictions, more transparency, and highly secured transactions when using this technology.

Source:
Richie Etwaru. "Blockchain: Massively Simplified" Retrieved from: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k53LUZxUF50

fields.title: Beware! Connecting to a Public Network will expose your Personal Data
fields.body:
Wi-fi hotspots that do not require us to enter a username or a password are common around public places. These Wi-fi hotspots are not guaranteed that it can protect the data that we are sharing publicly. Hackers can take advantage of these unencrypted Wi-Fi hotspots to eavesdrop to any data, such as personal information, current location, key account passwords, or birthplace, that is being passed from a gadget to the internet.

Byron, in his article "Public Wi-Fi raises hacking risk" stated that T-Mobile, AT&T, and other internet service providers or ISP don’t encrypt the data being transferred between a device and the Internet by default. This means that a hacker can easily get your personal data once you’re connected to this kind of network. Public Wi-fi networks usually don’t enable their WEP (Wired Equivalency Protection) or WPA(Wi-Fi Protected Access) on their systems. Therefore, it is advisable to use a VPN when connecting to unsecured public networks for extra security.

Here are some of the ways on how you can keep yourself safe on public Wi-Fi Networks. Avoid entering sensitive information when you’re using unsecured and public connection. Don’t connect to networks that have sketchy names. For example, "Free Wi-Fi Here", "Connect Here" or something like "Legit Wi-Fi". Last tip but certainly not least is to simply turn off the Wi-Fi of your device. When you’re done playing your favorite online game or finished with checking your email, turn your Wi-Fi off on your device.

Source:
Byron Acohido. "Public Wi-Fi use raises hacking risk." Retrieved from: http://abcnews.go.com/Business/story?id=3454066&page=1

fields.title: Not all hackers are bad
fields.body:
Hello friend. Today I’m going to talk about the good guys in the hacking world. Not all hackers are evil. The good hackers are called white-hat hackers and they hack all kind of technologies to look for any vulnerabilities and later fix these issues to improve its security. I was reading some news early this morning and I read an article that has a title hacker leaks Snapchat’s source code on GitHub. As I further read the article, the hacker leaked the source code because Snapchat is ignoring his report about a bug in the application and I learned that his intent is only to communicate this issue and hoping that the company will fix it. My problem with this kind of journalism is that there are lots of journalists today that are using the word hacker and they don’t care enough to specify the type of hacker they’re talking about. I think that it’s important to state whether the hacker is either white-hat, grey-hat or a black hat hacker, because the word hacker has gotten a bad reputation among the public and media.


Now Let’s talk about one of the best white-hat hacker in the world. He is known for his alias Moxie Marlinspike.





Who is Moxie Marlinspike?

Matthew Rosenfield, also known as Moxie Marlinspike, is a computer security researcher and the co-author of the Signal Protocol. His name has a pretty interesting meaning. Moxie is a synonym for boldness and Marlinspike means a tool used to separate strands. He was the former head of the security team at Twitter.


What did he do?

Moxie Marlinspike is the co-author of the Signal Protocol. Signal is widely considered the most secure and free encrypted messaging and voice calling application. His goal for this project is to bring an uncrackable encryption to regular people. Signal encryption also has been integrated into WhatsApp, the world’s most popular messaging app, with over a billion active users.


What is he doing now?

Moxie Marlinspike is now working on his new project called MobileCoin. MobileCoin is a cryptocurrency that uses blockchain technology. this coin specifically targets the mobile audience. MobileCoin’s main goals are to create mobile applications that make it easier to spend, manage and receive MobileCoin payments. More info can be found at their website https://www.mobilecoin.com/.



In conclusion, whenever we published something on the internet, we should be more careful in choosing the right words to communicate our thoughts. In addition, we shouldn't automaticaly assume that the word hacker means a bad thing. Hacking can be used for good and evil, it all depends on the hacker's intent



That's all for now, till next time!

fields.title: Bad Seal studios app store has been launched! +New project
fields.body:
Hello friend. First of all, I want to greet you a merry Christmas and I hope that you'll get many gifts 😊. Today, I’m happy to announce that Bad Seal studios has now a mobile app store! The google app play store is live, but the apple app store is not available yet (Sorry, apple users :P). I’ll be working on at least 2 more mobile application projects before I get back into working on web applications again. I already have the concepts for the 2 mobile projects and I will share more details about it in the coming days.




Ok, so about the new project, I developed a mobile application built in flutter that fetches and displays a list of top news articles from Hacker News website on your mobile devices. If you're not aware, Hacker News is a reddit-like website run by Y Combinator. Y Combinator is one of the most prominent startup incubators in Silicon Valley. I highly recommend the website if you like reading news about technology and entrepreneurship. Flutter is made by Google and is used to develop mobile applications for Android and IOS. Flutter applications are written in Dart language and it is very similar to other OOP languages, such as C++, C# and Java.

You can learn more about the project by clicking the links below:

Hacker News's Page





That's all for now, till next time!

fields.title: Let's practice some mindfulness. +New project
fields.body:
Hello friend. How are you doing? I hope you’re doing fine. I just finished working on a simple mobile project that is built using flutter. This project is a countdown timer that plays a loud sound at the end. You can use this app for activities such as cooking meals, yoga, taking quizzes, work, sports and more. I specifically made this application as a meditation countdown timer. Meditation is one of the activities that I want to do more this year. Meditation for 10 to 30 minutes a day helps to incorporate meditation into our daily life. Meditation also comes with a lot of benefits such as reducing stress, improving focus, improving sleep and many more!



My next project is going to be based on a research called “Dunbar’s number”. According to this research, we can only ever have 150 meaningful connections at most. This study became controversial because some people think that it’s impossible to make 150 meaningful connections and the numbers should be way lower. Here’s a good video that explains this study. I’m going to use Flutter to build this project and lots of research 😊.



You can learn more about the project by clicking the links below:

Meditation Countdown Timer's Page





That's all for now, till next time!
